paper_abstract: In 1911, Toeplitz made a conjecture asserting that every Jordan curve in contains four points forming the corners of a square. Here Conjecture C is presented, which states that the side length of the largest square on a closed curve that consists of edges of an nxn grid is at least times the side length of the largest axis-aligned square contained inside the curve. Conjecture C implies Toeplitz' conjecture and is verified computationally for n <= 13.
